intro: Conyza diversifolia, commonly known as the diverseleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and hairy leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza diversifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some regions.
